intro: Datura eximia, commonly known as the devil's trumpet, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its large, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshade plants, and it produces toxic alkaloids in its leaves and seeds. Datura eximia is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its growth is often associated with disturbed soils and it can thrive in arid environments with minimal water.
